data.title: Banaue, Ifugao Profile – PhilAtlas
data.meta_description: Banaue is a municipality in the landlocked province of Ifugao, Cordillera Administrative Region (CAR), Philippines. It has a population of 20,652 (2020 Census figures) distributed over 18 barangays.
data.text:
Banaue, Province of Ifugao

Summary dataTypemunicipalityIsland groupLuzonRegionCordillera Administrative Region (CAR)ProvinceIfugaoBarangay count18Postal code3601Coastal/LandlockedlandlockedMarine waterbodiesnone (landlocked)Philippine major island(s)LuzonArea (2013)191.20 km2 (73.82 sq mi)Population (2020)20,652Density (2020)108 / km2 (280 / sq mi)Coordinates16° 55' North, 121° 4' East (16.9109, 121.0616)Estimated elevation above sea level1,071.4 meters (3,514.2 feet)

Banaue is a municipality in the landlocked province of Ifugao.

The municipality has a land area of 191.20 square kilometers or 73.82 square miles which constitutes 7.30% of Ifugao's total area. Its population as determined by the 2020 Census was 20,652. This represented 9.95% of the total population of Ifugao province, or 1.15% of the overall population of the Cordillera Administrative Region. Based on these figures, the population density is computed at 108 inhabitants per square kilometer or 280 inhabitants per square mile.

Barangays

Banaue has 18 barangays as shown in the following table.

Economy

The annual regular revenue of Banaue for the fiscal year of 2016 was ₱83,135,392.46.

End notes:

Annual Regular Income = Locally Sourced Revenue + Internal Revenue Allotment (IRA) Current Year + Other Shares from National Tax Collection

Locally Sourced Revenue = Real Property Tax (General Fund) + Tax on Business + Other Taxes + Regulatory Fees + Service/User Charges + Receipts from Economic Enterprises

Demographics

Households

The household population of Banaue in the 2015 Census was 21,758 broken down into 3,929 households or an average of 5.54 members per household.

Population by age group

According to the 2015 Census, the age group with the highest population in Banaue is 5 to 9, with 2,413 individuals. Conversely, the age group with the lowest population is 75 to 79, with 255 individuals.

Historical population

The population of Banaue grew from 17,013 in 1918 to 20,652 in 2020, an increase of 3,639 people over the course of 102 years. The latest census figures in 2020 denote a negative growth rate of 1.17%, or a decrease of 1,185 people, from the previous population of 21,837 in 2015.

The total number of registered voters or electorate in Banaue for the year 2019 was 14,003, broken down into 7,135 males and 6,868 females.

Location

The municipal center of Banaue is situated at approximately 16° 55' North, 121° 4' East, in the island of Luzon. Elevation at these coordinates is estimated at 1,071.4 meters or 3,514.2 feet above mean sea level.

Distances

Based on the great-circle distance (the shortest distance between two points over the surface of the Earth), the cities closest to Banaue are Santiago, Isabela, Candon, Ilocos Sur, Baguio, Tabuk, Kalinga, Cauayan, Isabela, and San Fernando, La Union. The nearest municipalities are Hingyon, Ifugao, Hungduan, Ifugao, Lagawe, Ifugao, Kiangan, Ifugao, Barlig, Mountain Province, and Sabangan, Mountain Province. Its distance from the national capital is 256.90 kilometers (159.63 miles). The following list delineates such distance measurements.
